result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan M Kracht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evan M Kracht

defendant.name: Kracht, Evan M
defendant.address: W1773 Southern Road, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965

records.addlTxt: Amend JOC to allow jail sentence to be served in another county if 1)that county will agree to take him; and 2)the sentence is served as it would be in Jefferson County(i.e., without electronic monitoring). Please note that the defendant will need to report first to Jeff. County Jail, even if transfer is authorized.

[ma] Case called at 3:31pm
Defendant Evan M Kracht in court with Attorney John Lewis Allison.  Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

The Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence by 7/1/22 at 6:00pm 
---Mr.Kracht is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--no direct or indirect contact with Victim 1
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--maintain absolute sobriety from all alcohol and non prescribed controlled substances
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges

Days credit for time already served:  0  days

The Court does NOT allow expungment. 
recess: 4:00pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[ae] case called 10:40 AM Defendant Evan M Kracht in court with attorney John Lewis Allison. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--not to discuss the case with Witness 1 or Witness 2 outside the presence of counsel
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 10:44 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/23/22 at 1:00 pm   (2) Status Conference on 6/17/22 at 3:30 pm
